Posts.Content:
Oh boy! I meant to say I have 12 more rad treatments. 
I didn't know staging could change either But my RO, who was a medical onc, and has a PhD in physics looked over all my records and said it.
T2, OmniPod,Fibro,MVP,CAD,4 level cervical fusion, L5_S1 needs fusion, arthritis all over, need 2 knee replacements, Vit D3, and a lot of other meds!
Posts.Title: Diagnosed Stage IV today

Posts.Content:
Yes, my chemo nurses said to use Claratin for bone pain. It sounded far out to me too. I never had to use it, as I didn't hurt.
Nulasta, I had to get the shot the day after chemo. I had about
 2 hours, then it would flatten me. I'd be too fatigued to move. But it did keep my white cells up, and that's always good.
Posts.Title: Claritan before chemo and/or Neulasta or other recommendations

Posts.Content:
I used to have Aetna. Ugh.
Call them again tell them that paying for this now could save them a LOT of money in the future if your cancer has returned.
Best wishes!

I'm in Florida too. This blasted storm is messing with everything. My point is, if you are close to Tampa, try to get in to Moffitt. It's on the USF campus. Excellent!!!

Posts.Title: Lymph Node on Mammogram

Posts.Content:
I am so sorry! Things will be in a blur for you now. Do you have a good network of family or friends to help? Church?
My long journey started last April. I had more tests than I can remember now! But one was a PET, and I got my port started chemo right away. I didn't show any other places. Did a bi lat mastectomy currently have 12 more to go. My radiologist was the one who told me I had been stage 4, but the chemo shrank the tumor, so now I was stage 3. One was Huge!
I'm starting to feel like myself again. It's long, it's hard, and no fun!!!!!!
But you will get through it, the light at the end of the tunnel isn't a train
Best to you
T2, OmniPod,Fibro,MVP,CAD,4 level cervical fusion, L5_S1 needs fusion, arthritis all over, need 2 knee replacements, Vit D3, and a lot of other meds!
Posts.Title: Diagnosed Stage IV today

Posts.Content:
My bc was tumors, one was really big. After the Mamo, u/s and MRI I was sent to a breast surgeon. He reviewed all the films I'd brought, ordered a whole slew of tests, PET/ct, Muga, needle biopsy and a few more I can't remember. Then he sent me to medical oncologist who does the chemo. Then I had port placed. Then double mastectomy. Now I'm doing rads. And a pill for the next 10 years.
But I'm still on this side of the turf. And you will be too! It's frustrating, you want it to go away yesterday.
I'm not sure about
 the fertility question, I'm too old for that, your docs can give you the best answers.
T2, OmniPod,Fibro,MVP,CAD,4 level cervical fusion, L5_S1 needs fusion, arthritis all over, need 2 knee replacements, Vit D3, and a lot of other meds!
Posts.Title: Hi everyone...anxious and looking for info

Posts.Content:
I've had the injections, I'm not real fond of needles! As for the actual stuff, I didn't have any bad reaction. For one of them they told me to stay away from small children and my dogs for a few hours. I didn't think it was a biggie.
You will be ok, just remember to breathe!!

Posts.Title: hve to have full bone scan and am terrified of the radiation injection !!!!!!

Posts.Content:
I'm just starting treatment for LE. don't know much about
 it, but I've read problems can spread fast. Best give doc a call, go to urgent care or ER.
T2, OmniPod,Fibro,MVP,CAD,4 level cervical fusion, L5_S1 needs fusion, arthritis all over, need 2 knee replacements, Vit D3, and a lot of other meds!
Posts.Title: red spots on lymphedma arm

Posts.Content:
What is your fear of the material? That you will break out in a rash, or glow? I'm not laughing, just trying to understand. The fear of my cancer overcame anything else for me, and I got through all of it. Drink lots of water before and after the test to help flush it out faster. Can't you have a sedative before?
I had more tests than I can remember some were radioactive. The one that annoyed me the most was the day of my port instal, doc ordered 2 more tests, one radioactive, and off I went to surgery with a wire sticking out of my boob. 
If you do have cancer, it can be a rough journey. The drugs used are scarey. You need to talk to your docs, get help with your fears. Don't be a victim be a survivor!
T2, OmniPod,Fibro,MVP,CAD,4 level cervical fusion, L5_S1 needs fusion, arthritis all over, need 2 knee replacements, Vit D3, and a lot of other meds!
Posts.Title: hve to have full bone scan and am terrified of the radiation injection !!!!!!

Posts.Content:
The rashes and bumps could be an allergic reaction to all those supplements. 
Hospitals do charity care. Your dad needs proper care, get him seen. 
Or start checking into hospice.
Posts.Title: Former Breast Cancer patient - red purple bruising / bumps

Posts.Content:
I'd get a second opinion, maybe even a third. Are you close to a good cancer center?
When I got my dx I was stage 4, but chemo made them shrink. Had BMX, currently doing rads. I also was told I'm high risk for reoccurance. I'm at a loss too. Don't know what to do. 
Best to you
Posts.Title: Stage 4 breast cancer

Posts.Content:
I've had an allergic reaction to Taxotere. It's called hand foot syndrome. They burn, sting, are swollen and purple. My taste buds are burned too.
Does anybody know how long this lasts? It's awful!! Any tricks to deal with?
